articles.title: Cosmic Cartography: MIT Astronomers Map “Disk Winds” in a Distant Neutron Star System - SciTechDaily
articles.description: The 2D map of this “disk wind” may reveal clues to galaxy formation. MIT astronomers have successfully mapped the vertical shape and structure of disk winds in the Hercules X-1 system, marking the first time such winds have been observed in two dimensions. Th…
articles.content:
ByJennifer Chu, Massachusetts Institute of TechnologyApril 11, 2023
MIT astronomers mapped the disk winds associated with the accretion disk around Hercules X-1, a system in which a neutron star is … [+11120 chars]
